Complete INVENTORY Schema¶

http://sciencegateways.org/SGCIResource

Schema for an SGCI Resource

type

object

properties

  • schemaVersion

Version of the SGCI Resource Descriptions schema used for this description.

type

string

  • id

Unique identifier for the resource across all SGCI resource descriptions.

resourceId

  • name

Human-readable, displayable name for the resource

resourceName

  • description

Detalied description of the resource.

type

string

maxLength

2048

  • resourceType

The type of resource

type

string

enum

STORAGE, COMPUTE

  • resource

The resource object includes details about the storage and compute capabilities of the resource

oneOf

storageDefinition

computeDefinition

  • host

Network addressable name (i.e., IP or hostname) to use when accessing the resource.

hostNameDefinition

  • connection

The connection object includes additional details about pertaining to securely accessing the resource.

connectionDefinition

additionalProperties

False

resourceId¶

Unique identifier for the resource across all SGCI resource descriptions.

type

string

maxLength

256

minLength

1

resourceName¶

Human-readable, displayable name for the resource

type

string

maxLength

256

minLength

1

hostNameDefinition¶

label assigned to identify the device as an internet point of access

type

string

maxLength

256

minLength

1

dirPath¶

the general form of the name of a file or directory, it specifies a unique location in the file system

type

string

maxLength

1024

minLength

1

connectionDefinition¶

label assigned to identify the device as an internet point of access

type

object

properties

  • connectionProtocol

type

string

enum

SSH, GLOBUS, HTTP, SFTP, SCP, IRODS

  • securityProtocol

type

string

enum

PASSWORDS, SSHKEYS, X509, OAUTH2

  • port

type

integer

  • useProxy

type

boolean

  • proxyHost

hostNameDefinition

  • proxyPort

type

integer

storageDefinition¶

The Storage Resource Object is used to describe storage properties of the resource. All resources in the SGCI Resource Catalog are assumed to provide storage facilities, and as such, All resource descriptions must include values for the storage properties.

type

object

properties

  • storageType

High-level category to which this storage resource belongs. Determines additional properties that can be provided.

type

string

enum

POSIX, S3, OBJECT_STORE

  • connection

The connection object includes additional details about pertaining to securely accessing the resource. When specified as part of the storage object, the connection details only apply when accessing the storage facilities of the resource.

connectionDefinition

  • fileSystem

The fileSystem object contains information about the paths available on the storage resource.

fileSystemDefinition

  • capacity

The capacity object describes the total available storage on the resource.

type

object

properties

  • totalBytes

The total bytes of storage available on the resource.

type

integer

  • defaultQuota

The defaultQuota object includes quota information about the available storage per

type

object

properties

  • bytesPerUser

type

integer

fileSystemDefinition¶

The fileSystem object contains information about the paths available on the storage resource.

type

object

properties

  • rootDir

The path on the resource to use as the virtual root directory for all interactions with the resource. No interaction will happen outside of the rootDir path.

dirPath

  • homeDir

The path on the resource, relative to rootDir, to use as the virtual home directory for all interactions with the resource.

dirPath

  • scratchDir

The path on the resource, relative to rootDir, to use as the virtual scratch space; i.e., where running jobs should write to while executing.

dirPath

  • workDir

The path on the resource, relative to rootDir, to use as the virtual directory TODO

dirPath

  • archiveDir

The path on the resource, relative to rootDir, to use as the virtual directory to write job outputs to after execution completes.

dirPath

computeDefinition¶

The Compute Resource Object is used to describe computational properties of the resource. Not all resources in the SGCI Resource Catalog are assumed to provide compute facilities.

type

object

properties

  • schedulerType

type

string

enum

FORK, BATCH, ON_DEMAND

  • storageResource

storageDefinition

  • connection

connectionDefinition

  • executionCommands

type

array

items

executionCommandDefinition

  • batchSystem

batchSystemDefinition

  • forkSystem

forkSystemDefinition

executionCommandDefinition¶

type

object

properties

  • commandType

type

string

examples

serial

mpi

openmp

ccm

  • commandPrefix

type

string

examples

ibrun

mpirun

  • moduleDependencies

type

array

items

type

string

batchSystemDefinition¶

type

object

properties

  • jobManager

type

string

enum

SLURM, SGE, PBS

  • commandPaths

type

array

items

commandPathDefinition

  • partitions

type

array

items

partitionDefinition

commandPathDefinition¶

type

object

properties

  • name

type

string

examples

SUBMISSION

JOB_MONITORING

DELETION

CHECK_JOB

SHOW_QUEUE

SHOW_RESERVATION

SHOW_START

  • path

type

string

partitionDefinition¶

type

object

properties

  • name

type

string

examples

normal

large-mem

  • totalNodes

type

integer

  • nodeHardware

nodeHardwareDefinition

  • computeQuotas

type

object

properties

  • maxJobsTotal

type

integer

  • maxJobsPerUser

type

integer

  • maxNodesPerJob

type

integer

  • maxTimePerJob

type

integer

  • maxMemoryPerJob

type

string

  • maxCPUsPerJob

type

integer

  • maxGPUsPerJob

type

integer

type

object

properties

  • systemType

type

string

enum

LINUX, WINDOWS

  • version

type

string

  • nodeHardware

nodeHardwareDefinition

object

properties

  • cpuType

string

  • cpuCount

integer

  • gpuType

type

string

  • gpuCount

integer

  • memoryType

string

  • memorySize
